winrm_hostname.description: The hostname of the server we will use to run powershell scripts over WinRM. (Environment variable: AD_HOSTNAME)

winrm_insecure.description: Trust unknown certificates. (default: false, environment variable: AD_WINRM_INSECURE)

winrm_password.description: The password used to authenticate to the the server's WinRM service. (Environment variable: AD_PASSWORD)

winrm_port.description: The port WinRM is listening for connections. (default: 5985, environment variable: AD_PORT)

winrm_proto.description: The WinRM protocol we will use. (default: http, environment variable: AD_PROTO)

winrm_username.description: The username used to authenticate to the the server's WinRM service. (Environment variable: AD_USER)

container.description: The DN of the container used to hold the computer account.

name.description: The name for the computer account.

pre2kname.description: The pre-win2k name for the computer account.

block.description: `ad_computer` manages computer objects in an AD tree.

enabled.description: Controls the state of the GP link between a GPO and a container object.

enforced.description: If set to true, the GPO will be enforced on the container object.

gpo_guid.description: The GUID of the GPO that will be linked to the container object.

order.description: Sets the precedence between multiple GPOs linked to the same container object.

target_dn.description: The DN of the object the GPO will be linked to.

block.description: `ad_gplink` manages links between GPOs and container objects such as OUs.

status.description: Status of the GPO. Can be one of `AllSettingsEnabled`, `UserSettingsDisabled`, `ComputerSettingsDisabled`, or `AllSettingsDisabled` (case sensitive).

block.description: `ad_gpo` manages Group Policy Objects (GPOs).

gpo_container.description: The GUID of the container the security settings belong to.

force_logoff_when_hour_expire.description: Disconnect SMB sessions when logon hours expire.

lockout_bad_count.description: Number of failed logon attempts until a account is locked.

lockout_duration.description: Number of minutes a locked out account must remain locked out.

reset_lockout_count.description: Number of minutes a account will remain locked after a failed logon attempt.

block.description: Settings related to account lockout. (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-gpsb/2cd39c97-97cd-4859-a7b4-1229dad5f53d)

audit_log_retention_period.description: Control log retention. Values: 0: overwrite events as needed, 1: overwrite events as specified specified by `retention_days`, 2: never overwrite events.

maximum_log_size.description: Maximum size of log in KiloBytes. (64-4194240)

restrict_guest_access.description: Restrict access to logs for guest users. A non-zero value restricts access to guest users.

retention_days.description: Number of days before new events overwrite old events. (1-365)

block.description: Application log related settings. (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-gpsb/0b9673a7-ce0a-49b4-912b-591efdb37cdf)

audit_log_retention_period.description: Control log retention. Values: 0: overwrite events as needed, 1: overwrite events as specified specified by `retention_days`, 2: never overwrite events.

maximum_log_size.description: Maximum size of log in KiloBytes. (64-4194240)

restrict_guest_access.description: Restrict access to logs for guest users. A non-zero value restricts access to guest users.

retention_days.description: Number of days before new events overwrite old events. (1-365)

block.description: Audit log related settings. (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-gpsb/0b9673a7-ce0a-49b4-912b-591efdb37cdf)

audit_ds_access.description: Audit access attempts to AD objects.

audit_object_access.description: Audit access attempts to non-AD objects.

audit_policy_change.description: Audit attempts to change a policy.

audit_privilege_use.description: Audit user attempts of exercising user rights.

block.description: Event audit related settings. (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-gpsb/01f8e057-f6a8-4d6e-8a00-99bcd241b403). Valid values for all items below are: 0 (None), 1 (Success audits only), 2 (Failure audits only), 3 (Success and failure audits), 4 (None)

path.description: Path of the file or directory.

propagation_mode.description: Control permission propagation. 0: Propagate permissions to all subfolders and files, 1: Replace existing permissions on all subfolders and files, 2: Do not allow permissions to be replaced.

block.description: Settings related to File System permissions. (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-gpsb/abeebe06-49aa-44d4-ae5b-d6aff458e8e7)

max_clock_skew.description: Maximum time difference, in minutes, between the client clock and the server clock. (0-99999).

max_renew_age.description: Number of days during which a ticket-granting ticket can be renewed (0-99999).

max_service_age.description: Maximum amount of minutes a ticket must be valid to access a service or resource. Minimum should be 10 and maximum should be equal to `max_ticket_age`.

max_ticket_age.description: Maximum amount of hours a ticket-granting ticket is valid (0-99999).

ticket_validate_client.description: Control if the session ticket is validated for every request. A non-zero value disables the policy.

block.description: Settings related to kerberos policies. (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-gpsb/0fce5b92-bcc1-4b96-9c2b-56397c3f144f)

clear_text_password.description: Store password with reversible encryption (0-2^16). The password will not be stored with reversible encryption if the value is set to 0. Reversible encryption will be used in any other case.

maximum_password_age.description: Number of days before password expires (-1-999). If set to -1, it means the password never expires.

minimum_password_age.description: Number of days a password must be used before changing it (0-999).

minimum_password_length.description: Minimum number of characters used in a password (0-2^16). If set to 0, it means no password is required.

password_complexity.description: Password must meet complexity requirements (0-2^16). If set to 0, then requirements do not apply, any other value means requirements are applied

password_history_size.description: The number of unique new passwords that are required before an old password can be reused in association with a user account (0-2^16).  A value of 0 indicates that the password history is disabled.

block.description: Settings related to password policies. (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-gpsb/0b40db09-d95d-40a6-8467-32aedec8140c)

key_name.description: Fully qualified name of the key (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-rrp/97587de7-3524-4291-8527-3951711      0c0eb)

propagation_mode.description: Control permission propagation. 0: Propagate permissions to all subkeys, 1: Replace existing permissions on all subkeys, 2: Do not allow permissions to be replaced on the key.

block.description: Settings related to Registry Keys. (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-gpsb/13712a60-de1e-4642-bd9c-ab054dd86278)

key_name.description: Fully qualified name of the key (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-rrp/97587de7-3524-4291-8527-39517110c0eb)

value.description: The value of the key, matching the type set in `value_type`.

value_type.description: Data type of the key's value. 1: String, 2: Expand String, 3: Binary, 4: DWORD, 5: MULTI_SZ.

block.description: Settings related to Registry Values. (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-gpsb/3a14ca47-a22f-43c5-b35e-6be791003ca7)

group_memberof.description: Comma separated list of group names or SIDs that this group belongs to.

group_members.description: Comma separated list of group names or SIDs that are members of the group.

group_name.description: Name of the group we are managing.

block.description: Settings related to Groups Membership. (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-gpsb/b73d8bae-ed22-48aa-acba-7065ab52d709)

audit_log_retention_period.description: Control log retention. Values: 0: overwrite events as needed, 1: overwrite events as specified specified by `retention_days`, 2: never overwrite events.

maximum_log_size.description: Maximum size of log in KiloBytes. (64-4194240)

restrict_guest_access.description: Restrict access to logs for guest users. A non-zero value restricts access to guest users.

retention_days.description: Number of days before new events overwrite old events. (1-365)

block.description: System log related settings. (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-gpsb/0b9673a7-ce0a-49b4-912b-591efdb37cdf)

startup_mode.description: Startup mode of the service. Possible values are 2: Automatic, 3: Manual, 4: Disabled.

block.description: Settings related to System Services. (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/openspecs/windows_protocols/ms-gpsb/32deea3e-3fa4-414b-ba25-4121ad8c055c)
`ad_gpo_security` manages the security settings portion of a Group Policy Object (GPO).

category.description: The group's category. Can be one of `system` or `security` (case sensitive).

container.description: A DN of a container object holding the group.

sam_account_name.description: The pre-win2k name of the group.

scope.description: The group's scope. Can be one of `global`, `local`, or `universal` (case sensitive).

block.description: `ad_group` manages Group objects in an Active Directory tree.

path.description: DN of the object that contains the OU.

protected.description: Protect this OU from being deleted accidentaly.

block.description: `ad_ou` manages OU objects in an AD tree.

cannot_change_password.description: If set to true, the user will not be allowed to change their password.

container.description: A DN of the container object that will be holding the user.

display_name.description: The Display Name of an Active Directory user.

enabled.description: If set to false, the user will be disabled.

initial_password.description: The user's initial password. This will be set on creation but will *not* be enforced in subsequent plans.

password_never_expires.description: If set to true, the password for this user will not expire.

principal_name.description: The Principal Name of an Active Directory user.

block.description: `ad_user` manages User objects in an Active Directory tree.

dn.description: The Distinguished Name of the computer object.

guid.description: The GUID of the computer object.

name.description: The name of the computer object.

block.description: Get the details of an Active Directory Computer object.
Get the details of an Active Directory Group Policy Object.

display_name.description: The display name of the Group object.

guid.description: The GUID of the Group object.

name.description: The name of the Group object.

sam_account_name.description: The SAM account name of the Group object.

block.description: Get the details of an Active Directory Group object.

dn.description: Distinguished Name of the OU object.

name.description: Name of the OU object. If this is used then the `path` attribute needs to be set as well.

path.description: Path of the OU object. If this is used then the `Name` attribute needs to be set as well.

block.description: Get the details of an Organizational Unit Active Directory object.

display_name.description: The display name of the user object.

guid.description: The GUID of the user object.

principal_name.description: The principal name of the user object.

sam_account_name.description: The SAM account name of the user object.

block.description: Get the details of an Active Directory user object.
